intro: Taraxacum hydrophilum, commonly known as the water dandelion, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the dandelion genus, characterized by its composite flower heads and milky sap. The plant thrives in moist soils and is often found near streams, marshes, and ponds. Its leaves are broad and hairy, while its flowers are yellow and surrounded by bracts. Taraxacum hydrophilum plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
